skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: As one of the swiftest of airborne vessels, the Skycutter allows an Asur fleet to maintain aerial superiority over the battlefield.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: A lifetime spent fighting krakens and leviathans has taught the Sea Helm how to exploit the weaknesses of any colossal beast.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +10% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +10%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +20% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +30%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: For some Helms, conquest is less about lands being held and more about coffers being filled.
Only the Sea Helm’s ilk could map the treacherous routes through Ulthuan’s magical mists and shifting coastlines, and the perils of the wider seas.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +10% whilst at sea

skillTree.localised_description: Some Asur might find it distasteful for one to command slaughter such as this, but the results will speak for themselves.

skillTree.localised_name: By Order of the Phoenix Court
skillTree.localised_description: The powers of the Phoenix Court afford the Sea Helms great autonomy in pursuing and eliminating Ulthuan’s sea-based threats.
As the Lord of the Sea, Mathlann is patron to sailors and explorers; he is prayed to by Elves about to embark on a voyage or seeking new lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Fertility blesses farmers and mothers, but also those votaries who are caught abroad in dangerous lands.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5% for Spearmen, Rangers and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Spearmen and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who follow the Bringer of Wrath and Fire are blessed with direct and forceful solutions to the obstacles in their way.
The white-garbed hosts command the complex art of Elven naval warfare, conducting the battle above, on, and below the waves with flawless precision.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: If but one more would strike down our every foe, then we shall let loose once again!

effects.description:
Ability: "Unending Volley" for Skycutter and Eagle Claw Bolt Throwers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Patience and planning steers us like ships through a storm. Readiness shall anchor the crew."
Scarce has the first keel touched Ulthuan's shores before Elves stand in formation, ranks thickening as more warriors arrive.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5
	(characters's army when in own territory)

Melee defence: +5 when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A fluid and deadly fighting style, perfected for the maelstrom of combat on a ship's deck or a blood-drenched battlefield alike.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Wielding the sacred weapon of the Sea God, the Sea Helm acts as Mathlann's hand, their strikes guided by the ocean's cold fury.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
A technique performed with such speed and precision that it may appear to not have happened at all.
The High Elf fleet is renowned as the greatest naval power in the world, its training superior to all others.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers, Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers, Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers, Gate Guard and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.

skillTree.localised_description: Years of experience in mounted combat has started to pay off; this one is always in command of both their force and its steeds.

skillTree.localised_description: Being present at the very forefront of the assault, on many occasions, prepares one for future engagements of a similar nature.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +6 for Chariot, Lothern Skycutter, War Lion and Dragon Princes units

skillTree.localised_description: The firmament holds no fear for this one, such is their command of the many airborne beasts of battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing that it is the rare plan that survives contact with the enemy, yet being prepared for all eventualities, raises this one above mere planners.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard, Oceanids and Sea Elemental units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard, Oceanids and Sea Elemental units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Like a wall of the hardest stone imaginable - such is their ability to withstand attack.

Melee defence: +5 for Ship's Company, Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Silver Helms, Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Merwyrm units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.localised_description: When the gale always blows in the direction of your choosing, failure becomes a rare event indeed.

skillTree.localised_description: Speed, agility and control - all must be mastered if your crushing tide is to break perfectly upon enemy shores.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Rangers, Great Eagle, War Lion, Chariot, Lothern Skycutter and Ellyrian Reavers units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The very centre of the fire always burns the hottest.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Dragon, Phoenixes, Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -5% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -10% for all units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment cost: -15% for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The sky is the limit, with some finding it less limiting than others.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Great Eagle and Skycutter units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Standing tall against the sheerest of odds is a most inspiring merit.

effects.description:
Attribute: Expert Charge Defence for Ship's Company units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Some minds are more susceptible to magical influence than others, but this one is strong indeed.
On occasion, throwing the whole nine leagues at the enemy is just the ticket.
Mathlann himself has chosen this one to be his champion. Water itself obeys them.

effects.description:
Barrier hit points: +200 for Oceanids, Sea Elementals and Merwyrm units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Oceanids, Sea Elementals, Merwyrm and Ship's Company units
	(Lord's army)

Unit experience gain: +20% for Oceanids, Sea Elementals and Merwyrm units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Action, inaction, change – you name it, this one will work against the prevailing wind.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.
Why hit hard when you can simply strike truer?
Possessed of such eminence so as to spark others into bravery and action.
You really don't want to be on the receiving end of an attack made by this one. You really don’t.
Whether through natural insight or supernatural acumen, they can see one step ahead of the others.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Teary-eyed? No. Mysterious? Not that either. Versed in the veiling ways of murky vapours? Exactly.
Live at sea long enough and one starts to learn the lie of the deeps by instinct.
Sentiments - and indeed feelings of any kind - are not for public display, in their estimation.

effects.description:
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "There's always a way – always an angle. You just have to find it."
Not all eagles are born with wings, yet all share a soaring spirit.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Great Eagle and Skycutter units
	(Lord's army)

Global recruitment duration: -1 turn(s) for Great Eagle and Skycutter units (minimum 1)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Great Eagle and Skycutter units
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Those who have seen things – and lived to tell of it – possess a wealth of field experience and practical advice.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)
